intro: Calyptranthes capitulata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calyptranthes capitulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas of Hawaii.
